title: @Riot Nasus' and Renekton's story was freaking awesome buuuut...
body:
You mispelled Renekton's name twice.

Rito plz.

replies.body: Good catches!  We're pushing out fixes
Too bad this isn't Kha'Zix's lore, or i would make a bad bugfix pun right now.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Rubinio,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vpURiRhT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-10T20:22:44.526+0000)
>
> Good catches!  We're pushing out fixes

"fixes problems , delete's this thread" ~ Nothing was ever wrong http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/villains/images/7/78/Illuminati-Logo.png/revision/latest?cb=20150529234113
Also, in Nasus' story the author used "dispositions," which are an emotional state, instead of "positions," occupying a particular space.
No, this is correct.  'Dispose' can refer to arrangement, especially of military forces or legal matters, and 'disposition' is the way in which something is disposed.
I appreciate the correction; I've never heard it used in such a manner before.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Rubinio,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vpURiRhT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-10T20:22:44.526+0000)
>
> Good catches!  We're pushing out fixes

Hey Rubinio! I know this might just be the English Major in me, but in Renekton's lore, there's a sentence that goes "word arrived that a magical being of fire had escaped the magical sarcophagus that bound it in its underground prison." I know this sounds tedious, but the double use of "magical" sounds kind of repetitive. Just a nitpick though.
Change Magical Sarcophagus, to Enchanted Sarcophagus. That takes away the repetitiveness and gives a more vibrant tone than plain old 'Magical'
